solution.text:
Yes
Can be represented as xy = k as field size is constant.
So, as the number of buffaloes (x) increases the number of days they take to finish grazing (y) decreases and vice versa
The two quantities are inversely proportional.

content.text: Number of buffaloes (x) that graze a field and the number of days(y) they take to finish grazing one field

solution.text:
No
The two quantities cannot be inversely proportional as they cannot be in form xy=k.
Note - Remember that the two quantities are directly proportional.

content.text: Amount of food consumed(x) and number of people(y) consuming it

Yes
Can be represented as xy = k, where k = total amount spent.
So, if the quantity of the item(x) increases the price of the item(y) decreases and vice versa.
The two quantities are inversely proportional.

Yes

As x increases, y decreases and vice versa.
The two are inversely proportional.

content.text: Two quantities x and y such that \( x = \frac {15}y \)
State whether the following quantities are inversely proportional or not:

hint.text: Remember that any two quantities that can be represented as xy=k, where k is a proportionality constant are inversely proportional to each other.

solution.text:
Since the distance of the race is a constant = 1200 m
Therefore, we know the number of participants taking part and distance each participant runs are inversely proportional
Number of participants x distance each runs = total distance of race
12 \(\times\) Distance run by each participant = 1200
Distance run by each participant = \( \frac{1200}{12}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Distance run by each participant = 100 m

content.text: A 1200 metre relay race, has 4 participants in each team. Due to bad organisation, 3 times the participants come from each school and the rules are changed such that now each team has 12 participants. How much distance does each participant run?

hint.text: The number of participants taking part and the distance each participant runs are inversely proportional.

solution.text:

y =\( \frac {3200}{800}\)

y =\( \frac {1440}{10}\)

solution.text:
Since the total number of workers = 40
Workers who leave the team = 20
Therefore, Workers left for the second time = 40- 20 = 20
Since the numbers of workers and number of days to finish the job are inversely proportional we get,
\( 160 \times 40\) = Constant
\(20 \times \) (No. of days to complete job second time) = Constant
Therefore,\( 160 \times 40 = 20 \times \) (No. of days to complete job second time)
Number of days to complete job second time =\( \frac {160 \times 40}{20} \)
\(\Rightarrow\) Number of days to complete the job second time = 320

content.text: You are a contractor and are given a contract to pave a road. It takes you 40 trained workers and 160 days to finish the job. Unfortunately there is a problem and you must redo all the work again. 20 workers leave your team. How much time will it take the remaining to redo the work and complete the job for a second time?
Answer the question below:

hint.text: The total number of workers and the number of days to finish the job are inversely proportional

\(\Rightarrow\) ?= 325

\(\Rightarrow\) ?= 294

solution.text:
Since Number of workers and number of days are inversely proportional XY = K
Therefore, K \(= 1 \times 20\)
Now, 24 hours = 1 day
Therefore number of workers to complete job in one day \(= \frac K1 = \frac {20}{1}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Number of workers = 20

content.text: One worker can complete a job in 20 days. How many workers will it take to complete the same job in 24 hours?
Answer the following question:

hint.text: The number of workers and the number of days are inversely proportional.

solution.text:
Since Area is constant, Length and Breadth are inversely proportional. L \(\times\) B = A = K
Therefore, taking area constant, K = 50 \(\times\) 15 = 750 cm\(^2\)
Hence, if Length = 30 cm
Breadth =\( \frac {750}{30}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Breadth = 25 cm

content.text: The length and breadth of a given rectangle are 50 and 15 cm. Given that the area remains constant find the breadth of the rectangle when length is 30 cm.

hint.text: Volume of cylinder = Pi x radius\(^2\) x height

solution.text:
Since Volume is constant, the square of radius of cylinder and height are inversely proportional.
Pi \(\times\) Radius\(^2\) \(\times\) Height = Volume = k. Therefore \( r^2 \times h \)= K [Pi is a constant]
Therefore, taking case 1, \(40^2 \times 200 \)= K
Hence, K= 320000
If Height= 50 cm
Radius\(^2 = \frac{K}{height}\)
Radius\(^2 = \frac{320000}{50}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Radius = 80 cm

content.text: The volume of a right angle solid cylinder is constant. If the height of the cylinder is 200 and Radius is 40 cm. Find the radius of the cylinder when the height is 50 cm.

solution.text:
Since distance between A and B is constant, speed and time are inversely proportional.
Speed \(\times\) time = Distance = K
But first we convert all time to minutes. Therefore,
1 hour = 60 min
Time taken by auto rickshaw = 300 min
Therefore now in case one, K = \( 300 \times 30\)
K = 9000
In the case of the car, speed = 120 km/h
Therefore time taken = \( \frac {K}{120} = \frac {9000}{120}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Time taken by car = 75 min
